intro: Guettarda barbinervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined guettarda, is a tropical flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, evergreen leaves with prominent, parallel veins. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in terminal panicles, and it produces small, round berries that are edible but not particularly flavorful. Guettarda barbinervis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
